title: All - India kabaddi tournament
body_text:
As part of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) [CPI(M)] Kerala State conference scheduled to be held in Kollam from March 6 to 9, a variety of cultural programmes, competitions, seminars, exhibitions and other events will be held, said the organisers at a press meet here on Friday. The sports competitions include football, volleyball and cricket matches. An All-India Kabaddi Tournament will be held at Uday Institute of Kabaddi at Paripally on January 25 and 26. This tournament, offering a first prize of ₹1 lakh and a second prize of ₹50,000 will feature teams from various States, including both men’s and women’s categories. Teams from Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Telangana, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu, as well as from districts including Kozhikode, Kottayam, Alappuzha, Ernakulam, Kollam and Palakkad, are participating. The tournament will be inaugurated by Education Minister V. Sivankutty while CPI(M) district secretary S. Sudevan will inaugurate the closing ceremony and distribute the prizes. Hundreds of athletes had participated in the walkathon held in Kollam earlier this week in connection with the conference.
Published - January 24, 2025 07:39 pm IST
